RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUCK WILD settled off the early going, advanced through the far turn, raced five wide into the upper stretch, angled towards the rail, surged late and got up under strong pressure. BUFF AND SHINE chased the top pair early on, raced two to three wide around the far turn and finished gamely to the wire to just miss racing five deep. SUMMER ASH was off slowly, void of early speed, moved up from the far outside in the stretch and closed in belatedly. ALMOND CIDER dueled two deep outside of rival, had a clear lead into the upper stretch and weakened a bit the final eighth of a mile. BRANTLEYS BIG GUN was allowed to settle early on, saved ground and had no late rally. LOOKIN BACK LUCKY dueled for the early lead from the inside and tired readily.

ENTRY.NAME: Buck Wild
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, 5wd upper stretch, angled rail, up

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Lady Olivia at North Cliff Farm

ENTRY.NAME: Brantleys Big Gun
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground, no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M 70Y Turf CR: 81. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 20 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn N ational since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile Seventy Yards.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SACHMO stalked the pace along the inside down the backstretch, shifted out two to three wide from the outside of Spiritual King and just got up his final strides under all out pressure. SPIRITUAL KING showed good early foot from the inside to set the early pace, had a clear lead near the eighth pole and was wore down in the final stages to just miss. GALILEE was unhurried early under a tight hold, moved up near the inside at the five sixteenths pole, angled five wide and rallied willingly to the wire. GAMBLING TZAR settled off the early pace, raced four wide near the three sixteenths pole and had no final winning bid. JUMP FOR THE WIN tracked the early leader from the outside two deep and faded in the drive. SKIMBLE SHANKS was unhurried early on, raced along the inside around the far turn into the upper stretch and lacked a bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Sachmo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, shifted 2-3 wide lane, just up, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Spiritual King
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace inside, wore down lane, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Galilee
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, inside 5/16, angled 5 wide, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Skimble Shanks
ENTRY.OWNER: Rock Bottom Ranch and Warrior's Reward LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 5F Turf CR: 89. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 20 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be ru n on the main track at Five Furlongs.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BEACH WARRIOR prompt the early leader from the outside, engaged in a long duel through the stretch and just got up in his final strides racing two to three deep under strong pressure. CASH IN A FLASH vied for the early lead from the inside of Beach Warrior, dug in deep near the rail and just missed in a game effort. BUFFALO SHUFFLE stalked the pace, moved up four to five wide in the lane and finished willingly to the wire. FLASHINTHENIGHT chased the pace from the inside and was outkicked in the drive while racing three wide. HOLY MOLY MOSES chased mid pack, raced three to four wide into the upper stretch and raced evenly with no final kick. CONDITION ONE checked early along the inside in the early stages, angled five wide into the upper stretch and never threatened. MORNING MARCH coaxed along mid pack, raced along the inside into the upper stretch and lacked a bid. EYE OF GUNFIGHTER dropped back early, raced five wide near the three sixteenths pole and had no rally. GOLDEN TREASURE was off slowly and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Condition One
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, checked early, 5wd upper stretch, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Morning March
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along, inside upper stretch, lacked bid

ENTRY.NAME: Cash in a Flash
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, dug in rail, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Holy Moly Moses
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased mid pack, 3-4w between upper stretch, even

ENTRY.NAME: Eye of Gunfighter
ENTRY.OWNER: Hickory Made Stables and Celtic Venture Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 14400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ME DARLIN KATHLEEN showed good early foot along the inside down the backstretch to have a clear lead, widened its margin through the stretch, raced well clear and was a handy winner. HI HEELED WARRIOR dropped back early on, moved up from the outside into the upper stretch, rallied to secure the second place position but was no match for the winner. WARISHA coaxed along chasing the top pair, raced two deep between around the far turn and had not enough for the top pair. ROSE VALLEY was bumped slightly, in tight in the early stages, raced five wide near the three sixteenth pole and had no late rally. NOWYOUSCAN'TLEAVE was slow early on, raced near the inside into the upper stretch and had no response. CHA CHA CHIQUITA chased the pace along the inside and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Hi Heeled Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, outside bid, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Nowyouscan'tleave
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, inside upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Rose Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, in tight early, 5wd 3/16, no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 90. Claiming Purse 19900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 20 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Ente red For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YES SIR ROBERT dueled two deep outside of Nice Weather, kicked clear nearing the eighth pole and proved best under strong handling racing four wide. BEYOND THE BEND raced mid pack early on, moved up near the inside past the five sixteenths pole, angled out to race from the outside in the stretch and rallied willingly to narrowly secure the place position. NICE WEATHER dueled from the inside down the backstretch through the far turn and weakened a bit in the drive. HIDE THE RANSOM bumped soundly at the start, raced near the inside around the far turn through the stretch and had not enough. MR. PETE dropped back off the early going, raced two deep near the three eighths pole, swung wide into the upper stretch and had no late rally. CARGO SHIP coaxed along three deep outside of foes and faded in the stretch run. TURNPIKE BOB was bumped soundly at the start, raced five to six wide around the far turn and never threatened.

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond the Bend
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, inside 5/16, angled, rallied place

ENTRY.NAME: Turnpike Bob
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, 5-6 wide turn, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Pete
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2wd 3/8, swung wide upper stretch, no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 99. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 20 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FAMISHED showed good early speed to set the pace, drew off to be well clear through the stretch under a steady hand ride and was throttled down late. SALTO DE TIGRE tracked the top pair from the inside, continued an inside bid past the quarter pole and finished second best while racing three to four wide in the stretch. DEE JAY was off very slow, lost a considerable amount off ground at the start, raced in after the poor start, loomed four wide near the quarter pole and flattened out. STRAWBERRY TREAT was unhurried early on, raced five wide near the three sixteenths pole and had no final bid in the drive. EAGLES CRY tracked the early leader three deep and faded. HERE'S WALDO failed to sustain a bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Strawberry Treat
ENTRY.OWNER: Z and Z Stables and Barrett Judith M

ENTRY.NAME: Famished
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace inside, drew off, hand ride

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 20 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 20 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: I SEE THE STARS prompt the early pace three deep from the outside of rival and drew off to be well clear under a steady hand ride. SPOOKY ONE showed good early foot from the inside, met early on to challenge with I See the Start into the far turn, held the place position but was no match for the winner. FED CHAIR raced mid pack early, was four deep near the three sixteenths pole and kept on to the wire. DIXIE CANNONBALL stalked the pace, moved up four wide into the upper stretch and flattened out. OBROTHER ITSYLVIA dropped back early on, swung wide into the upper stretch and had no late rally. JIMMY THE KID was off slowly, raced near the inside around the far turn through the stretch and never threatened.

ENTRY.NAME: Obrother Itsylvia
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, swung wide upper stretch, no rally
